provisions.title: Section 0
provisions.content:
0) deliver or read any public speech, lecture, prayer, sermon
        or address of any kind or sing any sacred or secular song
        or enter into any public discussion or hold or cause or
        take part in any public assemblage;
    (g) play or make sounds on any musical instrument;
    (h) throw or place in any pond or water on any public recreation
        ground or in the sea or harbour forming the boundary of
        any such public recreation ground, any earth, wood, glass,
        crockery, metal, paper or other rubbish or refuse or any
        deleterious, noxious, offensive or disfiguring substance or thing
        or do anything to destroy or injure any fish in any such
        pond or water;
    (i) bathe or wash or wash clothes or other articles in or fish
        in any pond or water on any public recreation ground or
              IThe inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
   THE KZNGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (PUBLIC
         RECREATZON GROUNDS) REGULATIONS, 1935
          in the sea or harbour forming the boundary of any such
          public recreation ground;
    (i)   wilfully interfere with or obstruct the authorized user of
          any public recreation ground or wilfully obstruct any officer
          of the Corporation in the execution of his duty or in the
          proper execution of any work in connection with the laying
          out, planning, improvement or maintenance of any public
          recreation ground;
    (k) do, aid in or abet any act or thing which may not in these
          Regulations be specifically mentioned and which may tend
          ro the injury or disfigurement of any public recreation ground
          or to interfere with the use by the public for the purposes of
          exercise and recreation;
    ( I ) play any ball games or run, jump or fly kites;
    (m) fish off the beach or foreshore of any public recreation ground
          or use any portion of the beach or foreshore of any public
          recreation ground to park canoes and boats;
    (n) walk on any portion of a public recreation ground which by
          notice or otherwise is prohibited.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-(1) Every street in the Corporate Area shall be known by the
name already given to it or which may hereafter from time to time
be given to it by the Council.
       (2) Every premises in the Urban and Suburban Districts of the
Corporate Area shall be numbered, and save where the Council shall
by resolution otherwise determine-
     (a) streets and premises already named or numbered shall retain
          the names or numbers by which they were known at the
          time of coming into operation of these Regulations until the
          name of any such street or the number of any such premises
          shall be changed in accordance with these Regulations;
     (b) premises on streets running from north to south shall be
          numbered by allotting the number "1" to the first premises
          on the western side of the street at the southern end and
          by allotting the number "2" to the first premises on the
          eastern side of the street at the southern end, and the re-
          maining premises shall be numbered consecutively, so that
           the premises on the western side of the street will have odd
          numbers and the premises on the eastern side of the street
           will have even numbers;
               r h e inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 73119831
106   TFZE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (STREET NAMES
                   AND NUMBERS) REGULATIONS, 1946
          (c) premises on streets running from east to west shall be num-
               bered in a like manner, eommencing at their eastern end
               with the odd numbers on the southern side of the street
               and the even numbers on the northern side of the street;
          (d) premises on streets not running directly from north to south
              or from east to west shall be numbered from the end which
              is nearer the south with the odd numbers on the left and
              the even numbers on the right;
          (e) where any holding is created after a street has been numbered,
              every such holding shall be assigned as a number such
              numeral with the addition of such fraction or letter of the
              alphabet as rhe Town Clerk may direct;
          ( f ) the Town Clerk may upon the application of any person
               and upon the payment of such sum (not exceeding twenty-
               five cents) as the Council may from time to time by resolu-
               tion determine issue ro such person a certificate stating the
               number allotted to any holding and as to any change in
               the numbering of such holding;
          (g) the Council may from time to time by resolution require that
               the several premises on any street or part of a street in the
               rural district of the Corporate Area shall be numbered and
               may by the same or another resolution prescribe the side
               on which the even and odd numbers shall respectively be
               placed and the points at which such numbers shall commence.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5.-(1) The responsibility for collecting and accounting for all moneys
payable to the Corporation is placed with the City Treasurer. I t shall,
however, be the duty of the chief officer in each department to ensure
that the moneys collectable by the department under his control are
actualry collected and brought to account and that adequate safe-
guards are established to secure an effective check of the assessment,
and punctual collection and accounting for such moneys.
      (2) The City Treasurer and the respective chief officers must
ensure that the duty of collecting moneys payable to the Council is
assigned to officers on the permanent establishment.
       (3) Collecting officers are required to issue an official receipt
ticket or voucher as the case may be in respect of every sum of
money received by them.
      (4) Copies of official receipts should not be issued but a certifi-
cate of payment may be furnished upon application.
      (5) A collecting officer may in his discretion accept uncertified
cheques if the drawer is known to be a reputable establishment or
person the validity of whose cheque he has no reason to doubt.
       (6) Should a cheque be dishonoured at a bank on which it is
drawn, the City Treasurer shall decide on what action should be
taken.
       (7) Between the time of receipt and the time of payment into
the bank no municipal money shall be made use of in any way
whatsoever, nor shall any officer advance or lend any sum for which
he is answerable to the Council.
       (8) Chief officers and the City Treasurer are required to report
promptly to the Town Clerk any failure on the part of a collecting
officer to receive and duly account for any sums receivable by him.
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                  REGULATIONS, 1969
       (9) Each chief officer shall keep such books of account as in the
opinion of the City Treasurer are necessary to record correctly a14
sums received by his department and to ensure accuracy and prompti-
tude in the recovery of all sums due to his department. All moneys
received by the respective departments shall be handed over by the
chief officer promptly and regularly to the City Treasurer or paid
to such bank or banks as the Council may by resolution appoint.
      (10) The several departments whose charges for work done,
services rendered or goods supplied, are collectable by the City
Treasurer, shall render to him particulars of such charges without
mdue delay.
      (11) In departments not normally entitled to receive money and
therefore not provided with official receipt forms, any swms received
shall be at once entered in the value book and remitted to the City
Treasurer immediately in accordance with the procedure prescribed
in regulation 5(14).
      (12) The cashing of private cheques or postal orders from the
funds of the Council is prohibited.
       (13) All moneys received in the department of the City Treasurer
shall be paid direct to the collecting officer in that department who
shall forthwith isue an official receipt therefor.
The Value Book:
      (14) There shall be kept in each department a book to be known
as the value book. Whenever moneys are received by registered post
or are otherwise enclosed in letters or by any means in a department
not furnished with an official receipt book, particulars of such moneys
must be recorded in the value book as soon as the letters are opened
or the moneys otherwise received and the book along with the
moneys shall be passed promptly to the City Treasurer for bringing
the moneys to account.
Registered Mail :
      (15) The Town Clerk shall ensure that proper arrangements are
made for obtaining registered mail from the post office. These shall
include the naming of the persons to whom mail should be delivered
and the times at which deliveries will be made.
     (16) Registered letters must be checked against the advice slip
and opened in the office of the City Treasurer by two persons assigned
by him in the presence of each other. Where they contain money or
              IThe inclusion of this page L authorized by L.N.4119761
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                  REGULATIONS, 1969
other negotiable valuables, details of each letter and value shall be
entered in the value book and the entry initialled by both officers.
Letters containing no value need not be entered in the value book but
an entry "Nil" should be made beside the appropriate item on the
delivery advice and initialled by both officers. On completion of the
mail opening procedure the value book with the letters and their
contents must be handed over to the cashier in the City Treasurer's
office.
        (17) The cashier shall acknowledge receipt of the letters by
initialling each entry in the value book and bring all moneys to account
on the day of its receipt. The serial number and date of the receipt
issued for respective amounts shall be noted on the relevant letter
and in the column provided in the value book.
       (18) At least once per week a check of the value book shall
be undertaken by an officer other than the cashier or other officer
authorized to receive moneys or the officers opening registered mail
to ensure that-
     (i) except for those items marked "Nil" and initialled by two
          officers, details relating to all registered letters listed on
          post office delivery advices have been entered in the value
          book;
    (ii) receipts have been issued for all amounts entered in the value
          book and the amounts have been brought to account in the
          cash book, promptly or otherwise satisfactorily accounted for.
      (19) Delivery advices relating to registered mail shall be filed in
chronological order and retained for a period of three years.
Control of oficial receipts :
       (20) All receipts given by officers of the Council for moneys
received by them shall be in such form as may be prescribed.
                      Payment o f municipal moneys

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.-(1) A licence may be revoked by the Council if-
                     (a) the fees or any instalment thereof remain unpaid for seven
                          days after the same become due and payable;
                     (b) the licensee has sold or permitted to be sold within the
                          shop to which the licence relates any articles other than
                          those authorized by such licence and for which a licence is
                          required under these Rules;
                     (c) the licensee has been convicted for any offence against the
                          provisions of the Act relating to markets and slaughter-houses
Cap. 320                  or against the provisions of the Public Health Law relating
(1953 Edtn.)
                          to the handling of food, or against any regulations made
                          under any of the abovementioned provisions, for the time
                          being in force; or
                     (6) the inspector reports to the Council that the licensee has
                          failed to comply within fourteen days with any written in-
                          structions given under the provisions of rule 8.
                     (2) A licence may be surrendered by the licensee if he ceases
               to carry on the business for which the licence was granted.
                     (3) Where any licensee has paid fees for a full year on a licence
               and such licence is either surrendered or revoked in accordance with
               the provisions of this rule, the Council shall refund to the licensee
               that portion of the fees which would not have become due and pay-
               able up to the date of such surrender or revocation, as the case may
               be, had such fees been paid in instalments; and where the fees on
               such licence as aforesaid have been paid in instalments, the licensee
               shall not be liable to pay any instalments which would have become
               due after that date.
                              v h e inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 144/19951
THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (SHOP LICENCES)                     57
                       RULES, I965
       (4) Every licence revoked by the Council or surrendered by the
licensee shall be cancelled.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8.-(1) Except where such amounts are trifling municipal moneys
should not be taken to the bank for lodgment or fetched away from
the bank by a single employee and the City Treasurer or responsible
chief officer, as the case may be, is required to ensure that moneys
in transit are properly safeguarded.
                       Safe and strong rooms
      (2) In all municipal departments where moneys or other val-
uables are kept the City Treasurer or chief officer concerned as the
                [The inclusion of this pnge is authorized by L.N. 4119761
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                  REGULATIONS, 1969
case may be shall ensure that a safe or safes is or are provided for
the safekeeping of such moneys or other valuables until they are
disposed of.
      (3) The duplicate keys and combinations of all safes and strong-
rooms in municipal departments must be deposited with the City
Treasurer. The key or combination for each safe or strong-room must
be enclosed in a sealed envelope with the following details shown
on the outside-
                       Duplicate key or combination
        Department ................................. Office........................
        Description of safe.......................
        Registered No, of safe..................
         Registered No. of key ..................
                                    ......................................................
                                                 Head of Department
                                    Date. ...............................................
      (4) An acknowledgement must be given by the City Treasurer
for each duplicate key or combination deposited with him.
      (5) All duplicate keys and combinations deposired with the City
Treasurer shall be kept in the City Treasurer's safe. The duplicate
keys or combinations of the City Treasurer's safe and vault shall be
deposited with the bank in which the Council's main banking account
is kept, in a sealed envelope bearing particulars as in the preceding
paragraph.
      (6) The City Treasurer shall maintain a record of all duplicate
keys and combinations deposited with him. The keys and the record
should be kept in such a way that individual keys can be readily
located when required.
     (7) Except with the authority of the City Treasurer no safe
may be removed from one office to another.
      (8) No duplicate key or combination in the custody of the City
Treasurer shall be issued without the approval of the City Treasurer
personally.
148    THE KINGSTON A N D ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                          REGULATIONS, 1969
             (9) In the case of a combination lock the combination shall be
      set by the officer responsible for the safe and no other officer must
      have knowledge of it. Whenever the officer in charge of the safe is
      replaced the combination must be changed by the incoming officer and
      a copy of the new combination must be deposited with the City
      Treasurer in place of the previous one which must be destroyed.
             (10) Whenever the key for a safe is lost the fact must be re-
      ported forthwith to the City Treasurer who shall authorize the issue
      of the duplicate key. The issue of a duplicate key lor combination
      shall be noted in the record maintained by the City Treasurer.
              (11) Where a duplicate key has been issued in lieu of a lost
      key, the City Treasurer must arrange forthwith for the lock to be
      replaced by a reputable locksmith under the supervision of the City
      Treasurer. The duplicate key of the new lock must be deposited with
      the City Treasurer.
              (12) The alteration of the wards of locks, the making and fitting
      of new keys and the destruction of old keys must be carried out
      under the close supervision of the City Treasurer. The City Treasurer
      shall also be responsible for the re-issue and installation of altered
      locks when this is done.
              (13) The ex pen st?^ incurred in altering the wards of a lock and
      making new keys shall be borne by the officer responsible for the
      loss of the original key unless he is relieved of the responsibility for
      payment by the Finance Committee.
              (14) The officer in charge of a safe shall keep the keys therefor
      in a safe place and shall not give any unauthorized person access
      to the safe or its contents. The officer concerned will be personally
      liable for any loss of municipal money from a safe under his control
      which may be attributable to his own negligence.
              (15) No officer shall keep or allow to be kept in a municipal safe
       under his charge any items of value other than-
           (a) municipal money;
           (b) money which by virtue of his office he is bound to receive
                  and account for; and
            (c) valuables which it is his duty to keep and account for.
         In all cases an inventory of valuables kept in a municipal safe
       must be maintained.
               (16) In addition to the provisions in these Regulations relating
       to the handing over of cash, when an officer responsible for a safe
     THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                      REGULATIONS, 1969
    is handing over to another officer, certificates giving details of unused
    official receipts, tickets or cash receipt vouchers, keys for the safe
    vouchers other than cash and documents handed over must be signed
    by /both officers. These certificates shall be treated as part of the
    records of the department concerned.
                            Weekly cash checks

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. The fee payable for every licence under these Regulations shall
be one dollar for every thousand square feet or part thereof of the
area from which sand and/or gravel is to be removed with a minimum
of one dollar.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. A licensee shall-
     (a) at all times keep the licensed premises and all shelves, counters,
         appliances, implements and utensils used therein in a clean
         and sanitary condition to the satisfaction of the Medical Officer
         (Health) or Public Health Inspector;
     (b) at all times keep all doors, windows, and openings of that
         part of the licensed premises at or from which fresh meat
         may be sold completely screened with wire screens to the
         satisfaction of the Medical Officer (Health) or Public Health
         Inspector;
THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW (COLD STORES) RULES, 1965
  (c) not while any fresh meat, poultry, game or fresh fish is exposed
      for sale in the licensed premises permit any of the screens,
      doors or windows to be or remain open or to be so used
      as to permit the entrance of flies into the licensed premises;
  (6) construct or cause the floor of the licensed premises to be
      constructed of smooth cement or other impervious non-
      absorbent material, which shall be graded and drained to a
      properly trapped drain;
  (e) mark or cause to be marked every article of food or the
      package wherein the same is contained with the day, month
      and year on which the article was received for storage or
      refrigeration;
  ( f ) not receive for or keep in storage on the licensed premises
      any article of food unless the same is in apparently sound
      and wholesome condition nor keep any such article for
      more than twelve months after it was first received for storage
      or refrigeration;
  (g) not permit any person who is not the holder of a licence
      from the Corporation as a butcher or cutter to sell or assist
      in selling any fresh meat from the licensed premises;
  (h) not permit any person whose licence as a butcher or cutter
      has been cancelled to be employed in the licensed premises
      in any capacity;
  ( i ) not serve or sell in the licensed premises unless he is wearing
      boots or shoes and is cleanly and tidily dressed and wearing
      a clean white apron extending from the neck to the ankles,
      and a clean white cap, nor permit any person not dressed
      as aforesaid to serve or sell in the licensed premises;
  (j) not permit any person to sit or lie on the pavement of the
      licensed premises or on any bench or stall in such premises;
  (k) not permit any person to smoke any pipe, cigar or cigarette
      on the licensed premises;
  (I) not permit any person to use obscene, abusive or insulting
      language on the licensed premises;
  (m) not permit any person to create or cause to be created any
      rior or disturbance;
  (n) not permit any person to expectorate, urinate or throw dirt,
      filth, rubbish or litter otherwise than in the place set apart
      or provided for the purpose.
              THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW (COLD STORES) RULES, 1965
                                          Hours of Delivery

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11. The Council shall not grant any licence to cany on a cinematograph
         exhibition unless the Council is satisfied that all machinery used forthe purpose
                          [The inclusion of lhis page is authorized by   L.N   102/2001]
    THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (PLACES OF AMUSEMENT)
                           REGULATIONS, 1999
of such exhibition is enclosed in a room or structure and the following
requirements are met-
          all entrances and exits for the room or structure are suitably placed
          and are each fitted with a self-closing, close-fitting, door of fire-
          resistant material satisfactoryto the Fire Commissioner, and made to
          open outwards on solid frames of fire-resistant material rebated at
          the top so as to give one inch of overlap;
          all doors, openings and joints, of the room or structure are so
          constructed and maintained as to prevent, so far as is possible, the
          escape of smoke into any other part of the place of amusement;
          any openings, in the room or structure, for a projector lantern do not
          exceed two in number, are not larger than is necessary for effective
          projection and observation, and are covered with glass which cannot
          easily be removed;
          every projector lantern opening is fitted with a screen of fire-resistant
          material, which can be released from inside the room or structure so
          that the screen automatically closes with a close-fitting joint and no
          string or cord forms part of the apparatus for releasing the screen;
          no hmiture is placed or kept inside the room or structure, except
          one iron shelf not exceeding two feet in length by six inches in width;
          the place of amusement has insurance coverage, with a reputable
          insurance company, in respect of public liability, fire and allied perils.
          every opening through which any pipe or cable passes into the room
          or structure is bushed and sealed; and
          the place of amusement has adequate emergency lighting.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12.-(1) It shall be the duty of the City Treasurer subject to the
      directions of the Council to ensure that the accounting arrangements
      and the books and forms relating thereto are adequate and for this
      purpose he shall have access at any time to all books and documents
      relating to the accounts in all departments.
               (2) It shall be the duty of each chief officer to ensure that the
      accounting systems and procedures laid down for his department are
      faithfully observed and that there is no departure therefrom also
      that the work of keeping the accounts is kept up to date and is
      efficiently done.
             (3) Subject to the overriding authority of the City Treasurer
      each chief officer shall be responsible for the financial operations of
      his department. In particular he shall be responsible to see-
          (a) that no excess expenditure which has not been properly and
              previously authorized is incurred;
          (b) that all accounts submitted by him for payment are properly
              chargeable against municipal funds;
          (c) that all payments are charged against their appropriate items
               of charge.
              (4) The accounts shall be kept in a manner clearly designed to
      indicate that the intention of the Council as embodied in the annual
      estimates of revenue and expenditure approved by the Minister have
      been complied with. Accounts must therefore be kept by the financial
      year and shall indicate the receipts and expenditure under the sub-
      heads and items set out in the estimates of revenue and expenditure.
              (5) With a view to committees being kept informed as to their
      position in relation to estimates and expenditure the City Treasurer
      shall as at 30th June, 30th September and 31st December in each
      year submit-
          (a) statements of the actual expenditure against estimates of the
              several departments and these shall be submitted by the City
              Treasurer to the appropriate committees of the Council. A
              summary of such statements shall be submitted to the Finance
              Committee;
                     [The inclusion of thic page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (FINANCIAL)
                  REGULATIONS, 1969
     (b) a statement of outstanding amounrs owing to the Council
          and this shall be submitted by the City Treasurer to the
          Finance Committee.
        (6) In the case of revenue earning departments the City Trea-
surer shall submit at the end of each month statements of revenue
received together with the comparative figures of revenue received
for the corresponding period of the preceding year. Such statements
shall be submitted by the City Treasurer to the responsible committees
and to the Finance Committee.
        (7) As soon as may be after the close of the financial year, the
City Treasurer shall submit a statement of the accounts of the past
year of the Council.
                              Internal audit

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-(1) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary the service of an
employee not holding an office for which separate provision is made
in the annual estimates of the Corporation may be determined by
                                                                           -
140    THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (DISCIPLINARY
                    PROCEDURE) REGULATIONS, 1958
      the T~own Clerk without inquiry or ieason assigned therefbr by
      giving to such employee notice in writing expiring at the end of
      any week and the period of such notice-
          (a) where the employee has been in the continuous service of the
              Corporation for three years or less, shall be not less than
              two weeks;
          ( b ) where the employee has been in continuous service of the
                Corporation for more &an three years, shall be calculated
                at the rate of two weeks for every completed three years
                of service or twelve weeks, whichever shaIl be the shorter
                period.
            (2) Any such employee may be summarily dismissed by the
      Town Clerk for any misconduct which in law warrants such dismissal.
              (3) Any such employee whose service is determined or who is
      dismissed by the Town Clerk may within fourteen days from the
      date of-
           (a) the service of the notice of determination; or
           (b) his dismissal,
      appeal to the Disciplinary Board, and, if there is no such appeal
      or if the appeal is not allowed, the service of such employee shall
      be determined at the end of the notice or on the date of the dismissal,
      as the case may be.
         The provisions of paragraph (2) of regulation 9 in so far as they
      are not inconsistent with the provisions of this paragraph shall have
      effect in relation to appeals under this paragraph.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. It shall be lawful for the Council or the Mayor or the clerk
of the market in their or his discretion to refuse to lease or hire a
stail or station to any person or persons who shall have been con-
victed on two or more occasions by a court of competent jurisdiction
of any breach of these Rules or of any offence involving violence or
dishonesty and the Council may in their discretion prevent any person
who may have been so convicted from selling or assisting at any stall
or from engaging in the sale of any article whatsoever in any market.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. The manager or any of his assistants or any person authorized
by him shall be empowered to distrain upon any animal using any
pen or upon the carcass or any portion of the carcass thereof for
any fees which may be due for the use by the said animal of the
said pen and/or for any costs or expenses incurred in accordance
with rule 10.

                             Directions to Electors
  Each elector may vote only at one polling station and for only one candidate.
  The elector will go into one of the compartments and with a black lead
pencil there provided place a cross within the white space containing the name
of the candidate for whom he votes, thus X.
  The elector shall then fold the ballot paper so that the initials of the
presiding officer and the numbers on the counterfoil can be seen and the
counterfoil detached without opening the ballot papers; he shall then return
the ballot paper so folded to the presiding officer who shall in full view
of those present, including the elector, remove the counterfoil, destroy the
same and place the ballot paper in the ballot box. The elector shall then
forthwith quit the polling station.
  If an elector inadvertently spoils a ballot paper he may return it to the
presiding officer who on being satisfied of the fact will give h ~ manother.
  If an elector votes for more than one candidate or places any mark on the
ballot paper by which he can afterwards be identified his vote will be void
and will not be counted.

provisions.title: Section 20
provisions.content:
20. In the event of any person requiring to hire a stall for the sale
of any article or articles not provided for in the Schedule of Fees,
the fee payable and the terms on which such stall may be rented
shall be fixed by the clerk with the sanction of the Mayor or chairman
and the fees so fixed shall be payable by the person making the
application for the use of such stall.

provisions.title: Section 21
provisions.content:
21. Neither the manager nor any of the assistants nor any person
authorized by the manager to distrain shall be liable to any person
for any loss, deterioration or injury to any animal or the carcase
thereof distrained upon except for wilful negligence.
                            Slaughter of Animals

provisions.title: Section 22
provisions.content:
22. Every person renting any stall for sale of any commodity shall
use such stall continuously for the sale of such commodity for the
term of which such stall is rented and shall not allow such stall to
remain unused for such purpose except with the special permission
of the Council or the Mayor or chairman.
               -
               r h c inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
   THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (MARKET)
                       RULES. 1944

provisions.title: Section 23
provisions.content:
23. The slaughter of animals and the preparation and dressing of
the carcass shall be performed by persons employed for the purpose
by the Cowncil and in addition to the fees prescribed in the Third
Schedule the Corporation shall be entitled to retain and make use
of or dispose of for their own account the blood, stomach and
intestinal contents of all animals slaughtered as well as all carcasses
and organs and parts thereof which may be condemned.

provisions.title: Section 24
provisions.content:
24. No hirer or tenant of any stall shall use such stall except during
the period for which he shall have actually paid the hire, but no
non-user for non-payment of hire shall affect the accrual of hire during
the term of the hire or tenancy, and every hirer or tenant of a stall
shall quit and deliver up possession of such stall at a termination of
the period of his hire or tenancy. If the clerk shall decline to renew
the hire or tenancy of any stall the hirer or tenant shall immediately
remove all goods that he may have on such stall.

provisions.title: Section 25
provisions.content:
25.-(1) No person shall use any axe, cleaver, chopper, knife or
other similar implement on the slate, marble or concrete slabs of any
marker stall or any part thereof but shall use the wooden chopping
blocks and cutting board provided for the purpose.
         (2) The hirer and occupant of every stall shall be responsible
and accountable for all damage done to the slate, marble, concrete and
other parts of such stall or to the fixtures and fittings thereof and
shall on demand by the clerk forthwith pay the cost of any repairs
or replacements required as the result of any such damage and the
Corporation shall in no case be required to prove how such damage
was occasioned.

provisions.title: Section 26
provisions.content:
26. All carcasses, parts of carcasses and organs shall be dressed in
the rooms appointed for that purpose and after having been passed
by the manager or any person duly authorized to act for him shall
be placed in the cooling room and there retained for not less than 12
hours.
                                  Tripe

provisions.title: Section 27
provisions.content:
27.-(1) No person shall take into or operate within a market any
handcart wnless such person shall have previously obtained from
the Town Clerk a licence so to do and is wearing the badge hereinafter
prescribed.
         (2) The licence shall be in such form and for such period as
the Council may from time to time determine and shall be revocable
at any time by the Town Clerk.
               IThe inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
   THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (MARKET)
                       RULES. 1944
         (3) The badge shall be of such size, shape and material and
have thereon such letters, symbols and/or figures as the Council may
from time to time determine and shall be worn on the outer part of
the left arm of the person licensed.
       (4) No person other than the person to whom it was issued
shall wear any such badge.

provisions.title: Section 28
provisions.content:
28. No person shall within any market make or kindle or use any
fire for any purpose-
    (a) without having first obtained the permission of the Council
        and a certificate in writing of such permission signed by
        the Town Clerk; or
    (b) otherwise than in conformity with such permission and certifi-
        cate.

provisions.title: Section 29
provisions.content:
29.-(1) No charge shall be made for the keeping of carcasses or
parts of carcasses in the cooling room for a period of twelve hours.
         (2) There shall be paid to the Corporation in respect of all
carcasses retained in the cooling room longer than for twelve hours
the following fees which shall be paid before the delivery of such
carcasses or parts of carcasses-

provisions.title: Section 30
provisions.content:
30. Where in any market, refrigeration space is provided-
    (a) the Council may from time to time by resolution determine
        the class of commodity which may be admitted to storage
        in such space;
    (b) the fees for the storage of goods in such space are hereby
        fixed and shall be payable according to the Fourrh Schedule; Fourth
                                                                      Schedule.
    (c) all goods tendered for storage in such space shall be con-
        tained in clean baskets, bags of cloth or paper or such
         other containers as the clerk may consider suitable. The
         name of the person depositing the container and the nature
         and weight of the goods deposited shall be marked in legible
                                                  .-
                                                                          a
  THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (MARKET)
                      RULES, 1944
        characters upon the container or upon a tag or label securely
        attached thereto;
    (d) every person proposing to deposit any goods shall first pay
        to the clerk or such other person as may be authorized to
        receive or collect the same the prescribed fee and shall receive
        a receipt in such form as the Council may from time to
        time prescribe and shall tender such receipt to the officer
        in charge of the storage space along with the goods to be
        stored and such officer shall if he accepts the goods note
        upon the said receipt the receipt of the goods;
    (e) the officer in charge of the storage space shall have the right
         to refuse to accept for storage any goods for which there may
         not be space or which he may consider to be unfit folr storage
         and shall in such case endorse a note of his refusal on the
         receipt;
    (0 delivery of goods stored shall be made to the person who
         shall produce and deliver up the receipt issued in respect
         thereof and to no other person;
    (g) the Corporation shall not be liable for any loss of weight or
        deterioration of quality during storage of any goods how-
        ever caused;
    (h) the person depositing goods for storage shall not later than
        6 o'clock in the forenoon of the day following the deposit
        cause the receipt for the goods to be presented to the officer
        in charge of the storage space and request the return of
         such goods provided that if the day following the deposit
        is a day on which the market is not required to be opened
        such request shall be made before the closing hour of the
        date of deposit;
    (i) the clerk shall cause to be destroyed all goods deposited in
         the storage space-
            (i) the return of which shall not be requested within the
                prescribed time ;
           (ii) which shall become unwholesome or unfit for human
                consumption.

provisions.title: Section 31
provisions.content:
31. Every person driving, operating or in charge or control of a
wheeled vehicle of any kind including a bicycle which shall be taken
into a market shall obey all orders and instructions which may be given
by the clerk or any officer or employee authorized by the clerk for

require any such vehicle to be removed from the market immediately
upon the completion of the loading, unloading or discharge thereof.

provisions.title: Section 33
provisions.content:
33. No person shall enter the slaughter halls except the manager
and the persons employed by the Council and such other persons
as the manager may specially permit.

provisions.title: Section 34
provisions.content:
34. No person shall-
    (a) remove any tripe from the slaughter-house until after the
          same has been cleaned to the satisfaction of the manager or
          any person duly authorized to act for him;
    (b) on any pretence sell any meat in the slaughter-house;
    (c) remove or attempt to remove from the slaughter-house any
          carcass or part or organ thereof until the same has been
          marked or branded with the mark or brand for the time
          being prescribed by the Council;
    ( d ) do or cause any darnage to be done to any building, cattle
          pen or appurtenance of the slaughter-house or to any utensil
          or property whatever of the Council used therein;
    (e) light any fire or cook on the slaughter-house premises without
          the permission of the manager;
    (f) use any part of the slaughter-house except the place specially
          provided for the purpose as a urinal or latrine or for the
          deposit of any rubbish, waste or any filthy deleterious or
          obnoxious matter;                                               r?,
    (g) create or cause any disturbance or use any obscene, abusive
          or insulting language or swear or smoke or otherwise mis-
                                                                          r'
                                                                          L'
                                                                            )
          behave in the said slaughter-house or any part thereof;
     (h) enter upon the slaughter-house premises unless holding a
          licence from the Council or by special permission of the
          manager ;
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (SLAUGHTER-
                  HOUSE) RULES, 1940
    (I) take into or permit to accompany or follow him any dog
        into the slaughter-house premises;
    @ spit in the slaughter-house or any part thereof;
    (k) take into or cause to be taken into the slaughter-house
        premises alcohol in any form whatsoever;
    (0 assault, hinder or obstruct or incite any person to assault,
        hinder or obstruct the manager or any of his assistants or any
        person authorized by him to distrain in the performance of
        their duties under these Rules.

provisions.title: Section 35
provisions.content:
35. No person suffering from any infectious or contagious disease
shall enter or remain on the slaughter-house premises.

provisions.title: Section 36
provisions.content:
36.-(1) Licences to enter the slaughter-home shall be divided into
three classes-
     (a) butchers and owners;
     (b) carriers and attendants;
     (c) tripe cleaners.
       (2) A licence to a butcher or owner shall entitle the holder
to enter upon such part of the slaughter-house at such times as
may be necessary for him for the payment of fees to supervise the
penning, keeping and delivery at the lairs of any animal belonging
ro him and the receipt of the carcass after slaughter and cooling.
       (3) A licence to a carrier shall entitle the holder to enter upon
such part of the slaughter-house at such times as may be necessary
for payment of fees to perform the work for which he may be
hired by any butcher or owner in relation to the pen hired by such
owner, the delivery to the lairs and the receipt of the carcass after
slaughter and cooling.
       (4) A licence to a tripe cleaner shall authorize the holder to
enter and be upon such part of the slaughter-house at such times
as may be necessary for the payment of fees and receiving, cleaning
and removing the tripe.
      (5) Licences shall be granted free of charge to such persons
as the Council in its sole discretion may determine.
        (6) Licences shall be in such form as the Council may by
resolution from time to time determine and shall be revocable at any
               Ehe inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (SLAUGHTER-
                  HOUSE) RULES, 1940
time by the Council for any reason which in its sole discretion the
Council may consider sufficient and may be suspended by the manager
but such suspension shall immediately be reported to the Town Clerk
and con+hue only until the decision of the Council in relation thereto
and such licences shall if not sooner revoked or suspended expire on
the 31st March next after the grant thereof.
        (7) None of the said licences shall entitle the holder to enter
the slaughter hall or dressing or cooling rooms.
        (8) Any holder of a licence who commits a breach of these
Rules or otherwise misconducts himself on the slaughter-house pre-
mises may be expelled and forbidden re-entry by the manager pending
instructions from the Mayor or Council and may have his licence
revoked by the Council in addition to being prosecuted for breach
of these Rules.
                        Non-liability of Corporation

provisions.title: Section 37
provisions.content:
37. Neither the Council nor the Corporation shall be liable to any
person for any injury to any animal or for any loss or damage which
may arise or be occasioned and if any loss or damage shall arise as the
result of any act, neglect or default on the part of any officer or servant
of the Corporation such officer or servant and not the Corporation
or the Council thereof shall be liable for such loss or damage.
 THE KINGSTON AND ST. ANDREW CORPORATION (SLAUGHTER-
                  HOUSE) RULES, 1940

  All that parcel of land in the parish of Kingston containing three acres
more or less and butting northerly and westerly on land belonging to the
Water Commission known as the Kingston Pumping Station and on road
leading from Darling Street to the Kingston Harbour easterly on Darling
Street and Lindo Street and on lands belonging to the United Fruit Company
southerly on the Kingston Harbour and the lands belonging to the West
India Cold Storage.
